description: Saint Andrew the Apostle Parish, Monongahela campus, has canceled it's annual Summerfest Festival. Houston United Presbyterian Church resumed Sunday church service at 10 a.m. June 7. AFSCME Retiree Local 8402 has canceled its meeting scheduled for 1 p.m. June 9 at Sarris Public Library, Canonsburg.
text:
To minimize the potential spread of COVID-19, the following individuals or
agencies have canceled or postponed events, or are in the process of resuming
operation:

Saint Andrew the Apostle Parish, Monongahela campus, has canceled it's annual
Summerfest Festival. The Festival was scheduled for July 17-18 at the church
park.

Houston United Presbyterian Church resumed Sunday church service at 10 a.m.
June 7. COVID-19 protocol will be observed. Internet service will be available
after 5 p.m. at [houstonpresbyterian.org/](http://houstonpresbyterian.org/).

AFSCME Retiree Local 8402 has canceled its meeting scheduled for 1 p.m. June 9
at Sarris Public Library, Canonsburg.

Little Lake Theatre has postponed its summer productions of "Born Yesterday,"
"Sight Unseen," "Rumors" and "Little Foxes."

Western Center reunion scheduled for June 20 has been canceled and rescheduled
for June 19, 2021.

Meadowcroft Rockshelter and Historic Village, part of the Senator John Heinz
History Center museum system, will remain temporarily closed to the public
until further notice.

Nottingham Township Recreation Board has canceled the Community Day event
scheduled for June 27.

The NAACP Washington Branch 60th annual Human Rights Award Banquet has been
postponed. The banquet is now scheduled for Sept. 18. For more information,
call Phyllis L. Waller, Freedom Fund chairwoman, at 724-222-7824 or the NAACP
office at 724-222-7820.

All events sponsored by the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust through June 14 have
been canceled.

Mon Valley Hospital has rescheduled its annual black-tie fundraiser, Gala 32 
"Under the Sea" for Aug. 22. The event will be held at The Westin Pittsburgh.

The Pennsylvania Sports Hall of Fame Washington-Greene Co. Chapter has
canceled its 2020 induction banquet, which was scheduled for June 14 at the
Hilton Garden Inn, Southpointe. The Class of 2020 will be formally inducted
June 13, 2021 at the Hilton Garden Inn, Southpointe.

Peters Creek Evangelical Presbyterian Church livestream Sunday worship
services at 11 a.m.

Houston United Presbyterian Church canceled in-person services. Internet
services are available at 11 a.m. Sundays at
[houstonpresbyterian.org](http://houstonpresbyterian.org). The Meals on Wheels
program will still be operating at the church.

State Sen. Camera Bartolotta, R-Carroll Township, has temporarily closed her
offices to the public until further notice. Although the offices will not be
open for visitors, staff will continue to be available to constituents of the
46th senatorial district to respond to emails and phone messages. Constituents
can call the Washington district office at 724-225-4380. Constituents can also
email Bartolotta directly at
[cbartolotta@pasen.gov](mailto:cbartolotta@pasen.gov) or visit
[www.senatorbartolotta.com](http://www.senatorbartolotta.com).

Although the church building for Faith United Presbyterian Church, of
Washington, is closed until further notice, the church continues to hold
Sunday morning worship and other events online at Zoom. The church is now
observing its summer hours with Sunday worship at 10 a.m. until Labor Day
weekend. The Zoom link is available at
[www.faithupchurch.org](http://www.faithupchurch.org). Other regularly
scheduled events during the week are also accessible through Zoom links on the
website.

First Christian Church Disciples of Christ of Charleroi has canceled on-site
services. Services will be held 10:45 a.m. Sundays and broadcast on Facebook
Live. For more information, call the church at 724-489-9014 during office
hours, 10 a.m.-1 p.m. weekdays. First Christian Church is located at 61 Walnut
Ridge Road, Charleroi.

Abundant Life Baptist Church, 269 Cameron Road, Washington, will not be
holding public worship services until further notice. There will be a link to
all sermons, studies and classes posted at www.albc.church. For further
information, call 724-225-5355.

All Greene County Democratic Committee meetings, including executive committee
meetings, are canceled until further notice.

State Sen. Pam Iovino closed her district offices in Bethel Park and Robinson
Township. Iovino's staff will continue to provide constituent services through
the phone, email, U.S. mail and fax.

Point Marion Area Rotary Club has suspended all Rotary activities and
meetings. For information and updates, call President David Callahan at
724-208-9004 or Phil Rishel at 724-725-5245.

Washington Presbyterian Church (PCA), 100 Humbert Lane, Washington, will not
be holding public worship services. There will be a live stream service
available beginning at 10:30 a.m. on Sundays. For further information, please
go to [washingtonpres.org](http://washingtonpres.org), or see our Facebook
page.

The West Greene Lions Club golf tournament scheduled for June 12 has been
canceled due to the coronavirus.

The Senator John Heinz History Center and the Fort Pitt Museum in Pittsburgh
are closed.

The Silver Eye Center for Photography in Pittsburgh is closed until further
notice.

The Children's Museum of Pittsburgh and MuseumLab will be closed until further
notice. All areas of the museums will be deep cleaned while they are closed.

The West Newton Center for Active Adults will remain closed until further
notice. The center's staff is still available to answer phone calls and emails
from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. Mondays and Thursdays. The Center continues to offer
home delivered meals to those participants enrolled with the county, on a
limited delivery schedule, as well as congregate lunch take-out at the center
Mondays and Thursdays. For anyone interested in receiving a take-out lunch,
contact the center for more details.

title: Coronavirus closings
html:
To minimize the potential spread of COVID-19, the following individuals or agencies have canceled or postponed events, or are in the process of resuming operation:

Saint Andrew the Apostle Parish, Monongahela campus, has canceled it's annual Summerfest Festival. The Festival was scheduled for July 17-18 at the church park.

Houston United Presbyterian Church resumed Sunday church service at 10 a.m. June 7. COVID-19 protocol will be observed. Internet service will be available after 5 p.m. at houstonpresbyterian.org/.

AFSCME Retiree Local 8402 has canceled its meeting scheduled for 1 p.m. June 9 at Sarris Public Library, Canonsburg.

Little Lake Theatre has postponed its summer productions of "Born Yesterday," "Sight Unseen," "Rumors" and "Little Foxes."

Western Center reunion scheduled for June 20 has been canceled and rescheduled for June 19, 2021.

Meadowcroft Rockshelter and Historic Village, part of the Senator John Heinz History Center museum system, will remain temporarily closed to the public until further notice.

Nottingham Township Recreation Board has canceled the Community Day event scheduled for June 27.

The NAACP Washington Branch 60th annual Human Rights Award Banquet has been postponed. The banquet is now scheduled for Sept. 18. For more information, call Phyllis L. Waller, Freedom Fund chairwoman, at 724-222-7824 or the NAACP office at 724-222-7820.

All events sponsored by the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust through June 14 have been canceled.

Mon Valley Hospital has rescheduled its annual black-tie fundraiser, Gala 32 – "Under the Sea" for Aug. 22. The event will be held at The Westin Pittsburgh.

The Pennsylvania Sports Hall of Fame Washington-Greene Co. Chapter has canceled its 2020 induction banquet, which was scheduled for June 14 at the Hilton Garden Inn, Southpointe. The Class of 2020 will be formally inducted June 13, 2021 at the Hilton Garden Inn, Southpointe.

Peters Creek Evangelical Presbyterian Church livestream Sunday worship services at 11 a.m.

Houston United Presbyterian Church canceled in-person services. Internet services are available at 11 a.m. Sundays at houstonpresbyterian.org. The Meals on Wheels program will still be operating at the church.

State Sen. Camera Bartolotta, R-Carroll Township, has temporarily closed her offices to the public until further notice. Although the offices will not be open for visitors, staff will continue to be available to constituents of the 46th senatorial district to respond to emails and phone messages. Constituents can call the Washington district office at 724-225-4380. Constituents can also email Bartolotta directly at cbartolotta@pasen.gov or visit www.senatorbartolotta.com.

Although the church building for Faith United Presbyterian Church, of Washington, is closed until further notice, the church continues to hold Sunday morning worship and other events online at Zoom. The church is now observing its summer hours with Sunday worship at 10 a.m. until Labor Day weekend. The Zoom link is available at www.faithupchurch.org. Other regularly scheduled events during the week are also accessible through Zoom links on the website.

First Christian Church Disciples of Christ of Charleroi has canceled on-site services. Services will be held 10:45 a.m. Sundays and broadcast on Facebook Live. For more information, call the church at 724-489-9014 during office hours, 10 a.m.-1 p.m. weekdays. First Christian Church is located at 61 Walnut Ridge Road, Charleroi.

Abundant Life Baptist Church, 269 Cameron Road, Washington, will not be holding public worship services until further notice. There will be a link to all sermons, studies and classes posted at www.albc.church. For further information, call 724-225-5355.

All Greene County Democratic Committee meetings, including executive committee meetings, are canceled until further notice.

State Sen. Pam Iovino closed her district offices in Bethel Park and Robinson Township. Iovino's staff will continue to provide constituent services through the phone, email, U.S. mail and fax.

Point Marion Area Rotary Club has suspended all Rotary activities and meetings. For information and updates, call President David Callahan at 724-208-9004 or Phil Rishel at 724-725-5245.

Washington Presbyterian Church (PCA), 100 Humbert Lane, Washington, will not be holding public worship services. There will be a live stream service available beginning at 10:30 a.m. on Sundays. For further information, please go to washingtonpres.org, or see our Facebook page.

The West Greene Lions Club golf tournament scheduled for June 12 has been canceled due to the coronavirus.

The Senator John Heinz History Center and the Fort Pitt Museum in Pittsburgh are closed.

The Silver Eye Center for Photography in Pittsburgh is closed until further notice.

The Children's Museum of Pittsburgh and MuseumLab will be closed until further notice. All areas of the museums will be deep cleaned while they are closed.

The West Newton Center for Active Adults will remain closed until further notice. The center's staff is still available to answer phone calls and emails from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. Mondays and Thursdays. The Center continues to offer home delivered meals to those participants enrolled with the county, on a limited delivery schedule, as well as congregate lunch take-out at the center Mondays and Thursdays. For anyone interested in receiving a take-out lunch, contact the center for more details.
